mixk.utils.distributed_info module

class mixk.utils.distributed_info.DistributedStatus(value)[source]

Bases: Enum

An enumeration.

AVAILABLE = 1
AVAILABLE_AND_INITIALIZED = 3
INITIALIZED = 2
NO_AVAILABLE_INITIALIZED = 4
mixk.utils.distributed_info.all_gather(data, group=None) → list[source]

Run all_gather on arbitrary picklable data (not necessarily tensors).

Parameters

  • data – any picklable object

  • group – a torch process group. By default, will use a group which contains all ranks on gloo backend.

Returns

list of data gathered from each rank

Return type

list[data]

mixk.utils.distributed_info.gather(data, *, dst_rank=0, group=None) → list[source]

Run gather on arbitrary picklable data (not necessarily tensors).

Parameters

  • data – any picklable object

  • dst (int) – destination rank

  • group – a torch process group. By default, will use a group which contains all ranks on gloo backend.

Returns

on dst, a list of data gathered from each rank. Otherwise,

an empty list.

Return type

list[data]

mixk.utils.distributed_info.get_dist_status()[source]
mixk.utils.distributed_info.get_local_rank() → int[source]
Returns

The rank of the current process within the local (per-machine) process group.

mixk.utils.distributed_info.get_local_size() → int[source]
Returns

The size of the per-machine process group,

i.e. the number of processes per machine.

mixk.utils.distributed_info.get_rank() → int[source]
mixk.utils.distributed_info.get_world_size() → int[source]
mixk.utils.distributed_info.is_main_process() → bool[source]
mixk.utils.distributed_info.is_single_processes(group=None) → bool[source]
mixk.utils.distributed_info.master_only_run(func)[source]
mixk.utils.distributed_info.reduce_dict(input_dict: dict, is_average: bool = True) → dict[source]

Reduce the values in the dictionary from all processes so that process with rank 0 has the reduced results.

Parameters

  • input_dict (dict) – inputs to be reduced. All the values must be scalar CUDA Tensor.

  • is_average (bool) – whether to do average or sum

Returns

a dict with the same keys as input_dict, after reduction.

mixk.utils.distributed_info.shared_random_seed(low=2147483648, select_idx=0) → int[source]
Returns

a random number that is the same across all workers.

If workers need a shared RNG, they can use this shared seed to create one.

Return type

int

All workers must call this function, otherwise it will deadlock.

mixk.utils.distributed_info.synchronize() → None[source]

Helper function to synchronize (barrier) among all processes when using distributed training.

mixk.utils.imix_checkpoint module

class mixk.utils.imix_checkpoint.mixkCheckpointer(model: Module, save_dir: str = '', *, is_save_disk: bool = True, is_record_ck: bool = True, **other_train_info: object)[source]

Bases: Checkpointer

mixk.utils.launch module

mixk.utils.launch.launch(run_fn, gpus, *, machines=1, node_rank=0, master_addr='tcp://127.0.0.1', master_port='auto', run_fn_args=()) → None[source]
Parameters

  • run_fn – a function that will be called by run_fn(*args)

  • machines (int) – the total number of machines

  • node_rank (int) – the rank of this machine (one per machine)

  • master_addr (str) – url to connect to for distributed jobs, including protocol e.g. “tcp://127.0.0.1:8686”. Can be set to “auto” to automatically select a free port on localhost

  • run_fn_args (tuple) – arguments passed to run_fn

mixk.utils.logger module

mixk.utils.modeling module

mixk.utils.modeling.get_bert_configured_parameters(module, lr=None)[source]
mixk.utils.modeling.get_optimizer_parameters_for_bert(module, config)[source]

1.For pre-training or when finetune_lr_multiplier is equal to 1 , all modules will be trained with default lr . 2.For non pre-training heads, where finetune_lr_multiplier is not qual to 1, all modules other than classifier will be trained with (lr * finetune_lr_multiplier), Classifier will be trained with default lr .
